definition: dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: But 2009 will be a dangerous year.
sentences.chinese: 但是，2009年將是險象環生的一年。

sentences.english: He drove like a maniac. We had one near miss after another.
sentences.chinese: 他開車像個瘋子，我們一路上險象環生。

sentences.english: To rescue old housekeeper and the return of the crisis to return to France alone.
sentences.chinese: 爲了搭救老管家而隻身回到險象環生的法國。

sentences.english: The company was "in constant danger, " Swisher writes.
sentences.chinese: 公司那時正“險象環生”，斯威瑟寫道。

definition: to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
(of two vehicles traveling in opposite directions) to pass by each other
to run away/to flee in disarray
to be clogged up/to be congested (traffic, computer network etc)
Tsing Ma Bridge (to Hong Kong Airport)
driving under the influence of alcohol (DUI)
